com.mygdx.game

Class LeaderboardBackend

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mygdx.game.LeaderboardBackend

  • public class LeaderboardBackend
extends java.lang.Object
    This class handles the back end for the leaderboard.
    Since:
    Assessment 3
    Version:
    Assessment 3 An executable version of the game can be found at: http://gandhi-inc.me/downloads/assessment3.jar Our website is: www.gandhi-inc.me
    Author:
    Gandhi-Inc.

    • Method Detail

      • getListofScores

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String[]> getListofScores()
        Returns the array list of the leaderboard scores
        Returns:
        ArrayList it returns an array list of string arrays where each string array is 2 items big with index 0 being the name, and index 1 being the score

      • AddPlayerToLeaderboard

        public static void AddPlayerToLeaderboard(java.lang.String player,
                                          int score)
        This method handles adding new players to the end of the Game save file
        Parameters:
        player - - This is the name of the player that you want to store(type String)
        score - - the score of the player that you want to store (type int)

      • OpenFile

        public void OpenFile()
        This method opens the GameSave.txt file, splits the vaules held in the file and the populates the array list "arrayofpeoplewithscores".

        This method also contains error handling for if the file "GameSave.txt" does not exist. If the file does not exist, the method will create the file and populate it with Example players.

      • ReturnBestPlayer

        private int ReturnBestPlayer(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String[]> a)
        This function will return the best three players that have played the game so that they are able to be displayed

        This method also contains error handling for if the "GameSave.txt" file contains less than three players

        Returns:
        ArrayOfBestPlayers - This is an array of size three that contains the best three players

      • GetTopThree

        public java.lang.String[][] GetTopThree()
        A function that that returns the players names and the scores that have the top three highest scores.
        Returns:
        2 dimensional string array where on dimension is the players names and the other is the players scores
